text: waking up in a nation under military
rule people have spent their first night
under curfew between 10:00 p.m. and 5:00
a.m. but despite international
condemnation the capital appears
surprisingly peaceful and quiet as
universities and schools remain closed
as people commute to work on Friday
things seem business as usual the
soldiers have come out and brought order
to our situation now we will avoid
bloodshed I'm worried about the violence
we can see as an example what happened
in 2010 the anti-government
demonstrators have long called for
military interventions but Thailand is
deeply divided supporters of former
prime minister in luck Shinawatra
brother Thaksin have said they will
resist a coupe with force if necessary
she's been summoned by the military to a
meeting Marie COI BBC news
